issue.title: Is the new simulator working for anyone?

content.raw:
@{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817} I ran the command you mentioned yesterday. I see the virtual\_stix environment show up, but the vehicles didn’t populate.

‌

There were a few lines of red text in the gazebo output:

Early on, I get this one:

\[Err\] \[[LevelManager.cc:134](http://LevelManager.cc:134)\] Could not find a plugin tag with name ignition::gazebo. Levels and distributed simulation will not work.

After the CommsBroker Dbg messages, I get this:

Unable to read \[/home/subt-neil/subt\_ws/install/share/subt\_ign/worlds/virtual\_stix.dot\] file  
\[Err\] \[[VisibilityTable.cc:57](http://VisibilityTable.cc:57)\] Unable to populate visibility graph using path\[/home/subt-neil/subt\_ws/install/share/subt\_ign/worlds/virtual\_stix.dot\]  
\[Err\] \[[VisibilityRfModel.cc:36](http://VisibilityRfModel.cc:36)\] Unable to load visibility table data files

I also see this warning:

\[Wrn\] \[[LevelManager.cc:737](http://LevelManager.cc:737)\] Attempting to set performer with name \[X1\] , but the entity could not be found. Another attempt will be made in the next iteration.

‌

I can provide the whole console output, but I don’t see a way to attach a document to a reply \(maybe you can only attach when you create an issue?\)
content.html:
@Alfredo Bencomo I ran the command you mentioned yesterday. I see the virtual_stix environment show up, but the vehicles didn’t populate.

‌

There were a few lines of red text in the gazebo output:

Early on, I get this one:

[Err] [LevelManager.cc:134] Could not find a plugin tag with name ignition::gazebo. Levels and distributed simulation will not work.

After the CommsBroker Dbg messages, I get this:

Unable to read [/home/subt-neil/subt_ws/install/share/subt_ign/worlds/virtual_stix.dot] file
[Err] [VisibilityTable.cc:57] Unable to populate visibility graph using path[/home/subt-neil/subt_ws/install/share/subt_ign/worlds/virtual_stix.dot]
[Err] [VisibilityRfModel.cc:36] Unable to load visibility table data files

I also see this warning:

[Wrn] [LevelManager.cc:737] Attempting to set performer with name [X1] , but the entity could not be found. Another attempt will be made in the next iteration.

‌

I can provide the whole console output, but I don’t see a way to attach a document to a reply (maybe you can only attach when you create an issue?)
